original: Majjhima Nikāya 127
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Discourses

original: Anuruddhasutta
analyzed: anuruddhasutta
translated: With Anuruddha

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.🔽Atha kho pañcakaṅgo thapati aññataraṁ purisaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme  atha kho pañcakaṅgaḥ thapati aññataram purisam āmantesi
translated: Once the Blessed One was staying at Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.

original: “ehi tvaṁ, ambho purisa, yenāyasmā anuruddho tenupasaṅkama; upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena āyasmato anuruddhassa pāde sirasā vandāhi:
analyzed: ehi tva ambho purisa yena āyasmataḥ anuruddhaḥ tena upasaṅkama upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena āyasmataḥ anuruddhassa pāde sirasā vandāhi
translated: Then the householder Pañcakaṅga told a man, “Come, good man. Go to the venerable Anuruddha, pay respect in my name with your head at his feet, and say:

original: ‘pañcakaṅgo, bhante, thapati āyasmato anuruddhassa pāde sirasā vandatī’ti;
analyzed: pañcakaṅgaḥ bhante thapati āyasmataḥ anuruddhassa pāde sirasā vandati iti
translated: ‘Venerable sir, the householder Pañcakaṅga pays respect with his head at the venerable Anuruddha’s feet.

original: evañca vadehi:
analyzed: evañca vadehi
translated: And say this:

original: ‘adhivāsetu kira, bhante, āyasmā anuruddho pañcakaṅgassa thapatissa svātanāya attacatuttho bhattaṁ;
analyzed: adhivāsetu kira bhante āyasmai anuruddho pañcakaṅgassa thapatissa svātanāya atta catutthaḥ bhatta
translated: ‘Venerable sir, may the venerable Anuruddha together with three companions accept tomorrow’s meal from the householder Pañcakaṅga.

original: yena ca kira, bhante, āyasmā anuruddho pagevataraṁ āgaccheyya;
analyzed: yena ca kira bhante āyasmai anuruddho pagevataram āgaccheyya
translated: And may the venerable Anuruddha come at an early hour,

original: pañcakaṅgo, bhante, thapati bahukicco bahukaraṇīyo rājakaraṇīyenā’”ti.
analyzed: pañca kaṅgaḥ bhante thapati bahu kiccaḥ bahu karaṇīyaḥ rāja karaṇīyena ati
translated: for the householder Pañcakaṅga is very busy and has much to do with kings’ duties.’”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho so puriso pañcakaṅgassa thapatissa paṭissutvā yenāyasmā anuruddho🔽tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ anuruddhaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.🔽Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho so puriso āyasmantaṁ anuruddhaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho so puriso pañcakaṅgassa thapatissa paṭissutvā yena ayasmai anuruddho  tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam anuruddham abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi  ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho saḥ purisaḥ āyasmantam anuruddham etat avoca
translated: “Yes, dear sir,” he replied, and he went to Ven. Anuruddha, bowed down to him, sat to one side,

original: “pañcakaṅgo, bhante, thapati āyasmato anuruddhassa pāde sirasā vandati, evañca vadeti:
analyzed: pañcakaṅgaḥ bhante thapati āyasmataḥ anuruddhassa pāde sirasā vandati evañca vada iti
translated: and said to him, “Master Anuruddha, the master of five-limbed recitation, the master of five-limbed recitation bows down with his head at your feet, saying,

original: ‘adhivāsetu kira, bhante, āyasmā anuruddho pañcakaṅgassa thapatissa svātanāya attacatuttho bhattaṁ;
analyzed: adhivāsetu kira bhante āyasmai anuruddho pañcakaṅgassa thapatissa svātanāya atta catutthaḥ bhatta
translated: ‘May Master Anuruddha, together with three companions, accept today’s meal from the master of five-limbed recitation.

original: yena ca kira, bhante, āyasmā anuruddho pagevataraṁ āgaccheyya;
analyzed: yena ca kira bhante āyasmai anuruddho pagevataram āgaccheyya
translated: And may Master Anuruddha come at a suitable time.

original: pañcakaṅgo, bhante, thapati bahukicco bahukaraṇīyo rājakaraṇīyenā’”ti.
analyzed: pañca kaṅgaḥ bhante thapati bahu kiccaḥ bahu karaṇīyaḥ rāja karaṇīyena ati
translated: The master of five-limbed recitation is very busy and has a lot of work with royal duties.’”

original: Adhivāsesi kho āyasmā anuruddho tuṇhībhāvena.
analyzed: adhivāsesi kho āyasmai anuruddhaḥ tuṇhībhāvena
translated: Ven. Anuruddha acquiesced by remaining silent.

original: Atha kho āyasmā anuruddho tassā rattiyā accayena pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai anuruddho tassāḥ rattiyāḥ accayena pubbaṇha samayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya
translated: Then, when the night had passed, Ven. Anuruddha, early in the morning, adjusted his under robe and–carrying his bowl & robes–went to the house of the master of five-limbed recitation.

original: yena pañcakaṅgassa thapatissa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.🔽Atha kho pañcakaṅgo thapati āyasmantaṁ anuruddhaṁ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesi sampavāresi.
analyzed: yena pañcakaṅgassa thapatissa nivesanam tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi  atha kho pañcakaṅgaḥ thapati āyasmantam anuruddham paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesi sampavāresi
translated: and went to the house of the merchant, Pañcakaṅga, and sat down on the prepared seat.🔽Then the merchant, Pañcakaṅga, with his own hand served and satisfied the venerable Anuruddha with exquisite staple and non-staple food.

original: Atha kho pañcakaṅgo thapati āyasmantaṁ anuruddhaṁ bhuttāviṁ onītapattapāṇiṁ aññataraṁ nīcaṁ āsanaṁ gahetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho pañcakaṅgaḥ thapati āyasmantam anuruddham bhuttāvim onīta patta pāṇim aññataram nīcam āsanam gahetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: When the venerable Anuruddha had eaten and had withdrawn his hand from the bowl, the merchant, Pañcakaṅga, took a low seat, sat down at one side,

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho pañcakaṅgo thapati āyasmantaṁ anuruddhaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho pañcakaṅgaḥ thapatiḥ āyasmantam anuruddham etat avoca
translated: and said to the venerable Anuruddha:

original: “Idha maṁ, bhante, therā bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā evamāhaṁsu:
analyzed: idha ma bhante therāḥ bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā evam āhasu
translated: “Venerable Anuruddha, the senior monks have been here and have said:

original: ‘appamāṇaṁ, gahapati, cetovimuttiṁ bhāvehī’ti.
analyzed: appamāṇa gahapati cetaḥ vimuttim bhāvehi iti
translated: ‘Householder, develop the immeasurable deliverance of mind.’

original: Ekacce therā evamāhaṁsu:
analyzed: ekacce therāḥ
translated: Some senior monks have said:

original: ‘mahaggataṁ, gahapati, cetovimuttiṁ bhāvehī’ti.
analyzed: mahaggata gahapati cetaḥ vimuttim bhāvehi iti
translated: ‘Householder, develop the exalted deliverance of mind.’🔽Now, venerable Anuruddha, what is the immeasurable deliverance of mind?

original: Yā cāyaṁ, bhante, appamāṇā cetovimutti yā ca mahaggatā cetovimutti—
analyzed: yā ca aya bhante appamāṇā cetaḥ vimutti yā ca mahaggatā cetaḥ vimutti
translated: What is the exalted deliverance of mind?

original: ime dhammā nānatthā ceva nānābyañjanā ca, udāhu ekatthā byañjanameva nānan”ti?
analyzed: ime dhammā nānatthā ca iva nānā byañjanā ca udāhu ekatthā byañjanam eva
translated: “Are these things different in meaning and different in name, or are they one in meaning and different only in name?”

original: “Tena hi, gahapati, taṁyevettha paṭibhātu, apaṇṇakante ito bhavissatī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi gahapati tayā iva itthā paṭibhātu a paṇṇa kante itas bhavissati iti
translated: “Well then, householder, let the meaning be explained. The answer will come from the meaning.”

original: “Mayhaṁ kho, bhante, evaṁ hoti:
analyzed: mayham kho bhante evam hoti
translated: “Venerable sir, I think thus:

original: ‘yā cāyaṁ appamāṇā cetovimutti yā ca mahaggatā cetovimutti ime dhammā ekatthā byañjanameva nānan’”ti.
analyzed: yā ca ayam appamāṇā cetaḥ vimutti yā ca mahaggatā cetaḥ vimutti ime dhammā ekatthāḥ byañjanam eva nānanti
translated: ‘The deliverance of mind through nothingness and the deliverance of mind through the infinitude of consciousness are one in meaning and different only in name.’”

original: “Yā cāyaṁ, gahapati, appamāṇā cetovimutti yā ca mahaggatā cetovimutti ime dhammā nānatthā ceva nānābyañjanā ca.
analyzed: yā ca aya gahapati appamāṇā cetaḥ vimutti yā ca mahaggatā cetaḥ vimutti ime dhammā nānatthā ca iva nānā byañjanā ca
translated: “The deliverance of mind through nothingness and the deliverance of mind through the infinitude of consciousness are different in meaning and different in name.

original: Tadamināpetaṁ, gahapati, pariyāyena veditabbaṁ yathā ime dhammā nānatthā ceva nānābyañjanā ca.
analyzed: gahapati pariyāyena veditabbam yathā ime dhammā nānatthā ca iva nānā byañjanā ca
translated: And this can be understood in another way too:

original: Katamā ca, gahapati, appamāṇā cetovimutti?
analyzed: katamā ca gahapati appamāṇā cetaḥ vimutti
translated: “And what, householder, is the deliverance of mind through nothingness?

original: Idha, gahapati, bhikkhu mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṁ disaṁ pharitvā viharati, tathā
analyzed: idha gahapati bhikkhu mettā sahagatena cetasā ekam disam pharitvā viharati tathā
translated: Here a bhikkhu dwells pervading one quarter with a mind imbued with loving-kindness, likewise the second, likewise the third, likewise the fourth; so above, below, around, and everywhere, and to all as to himself, he dwells pervading the entire world with a mind imbued with loving-kindness, abundant, exalted, immeasurable, without hostility and without ill will.

original: dutiyaṁ tathā tatiyaṁ tathā catutthaṁ; iti uddhamadho tiriyaṁ sabbadhi sabbattatāya🔽sabbāvantaṁ lokaṁ mettāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena
analyzed: dutiyam tathā tatiyam tathā catutthaḥ iti uddham adhas tiriyam sabbadhi sabbattatāya  sabbāvantam lokam mettā sahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena
translated: the second, the third, the fourth, so above, below, around, and everywhere, and to all as to himself,

original: abyābajjhena pharitvā viharati.🔽Karuṇāsahagatena cetasā …
analyzed: a byābajjhena pharitvā viharati  karuṇā sahagatena cetasā
translated: he abides pervading the all-encompassing world with a mind imbued with loving-kindness, abundant, exalted, immeasurable, without hostility and without ill will.🔽With a mind imbued with compassion…

original: muditāsahagatena cetasā …
analyzed: muditā sahagatena cetasā
translated: with a mind imbued with sympathetic joy…

original: upekkhāsahagatena cetasā ekaṁ disaṁ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṁ tathā tatiyaṁ
analyzed: upekkhā sahagatena cetasā ekam disam pharitvā viharati tathā dutiyam tathā tatiya
translated: with a mind imbued with equanimity, abundant, exalted, immeasurable, without hostility and without ill will, he abides pervading one quarter,

original: tathā catutthaṁ; iti uddhamadho tiriyaṁ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṁ lokaṁ upekkhāsahagatena
analyzed: tathā catutthaḥ iti uddham adhas tiriyam sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantam lokam upekkhā sahagatena
translated: so the second, the third, the fourth. Thus above, below, around, and everywhere, and to all as to himself,

original: cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyābajjhena pharitvā viharati.
analyzed: cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyābajjhena pharitvā viharati
translated: he abides pervading the all-encompassing world with a mind imbued with equanimity, abundant, exalted, immeasurable, without hostility and without ill will.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati, gahapati, appamāṇā cetovimutti.
analyzed: ayam vuccati gahapati appamāṇā cetaḥ vimutti
translated: This is called the measureless deliverance of mind.

original: Katamā ca, gahapati, mahaggatā cetovimutti?
analyzed: katamā ca gahapati mahaggatā cetaḥ vimutti
translated: And what is the exalted deliverance of mind?

original: Idha, gahapati, bhikkhu yāvatā ekaṁ rukkhamūlaṁ mahaggatanti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati.
analyzed: idha gahapati bhikkhu yāvatā ekam rukkha mūlam mahaggatanti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati
translated: Here, a bhikkhu abides resolved upon an area the size of the root of one tree, pervading it as exalted:

original: Ayaṁ vuccati, gahapati, mahaggatā cetovimutti.
analyzed: ayam vuccati gahapati mahaggatā cetaḥ vimutti
translated: This is called the liberation of the mind by the expansive.

original: Idha pana, gahapati, bhikkhu yāvatā dve vā tīṇi vā rukkhamūlāni mahaggatanti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati.
analyzed: idha pana gahapati bhikkhu yāvatā dve vā tīṇi vā rukkha mūlāni mahaggatanti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati
translated: “Again, a bhikkhu abides resolved upon and pervading an area with two or three tree-roots as ‘expansive.’

original: Ayampi vuccati, gahapati, mahaggatā cetovimutti.
analyzed: ayam pi vuccati gahapati mahaggatā cetaḥ vimutti
translated: This too is called the liberation of the mind by the expansive.

original: Idha pana, gahapati, bhikkhu yāvatā ekaṁ gāmakkhettaṁ mahaggatanti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati.
analyzed: idha pana gahapati bhikkhu yāvatā ekam gāma khettam mahaggatanti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati
translated: “Again, a bhikkhu abides resolved upon and pervading an area with one village as ‘expansive.’

original: Ayampi vuccati, gahapati, mahaggatā cetovimutti.
analyzed: ayam pi vuccati gahapati mahaggatā cetaḥ vimutti
translated: This too is called the liberation of the mind by the expansive.

original: Idha pana, gahapati, bhikkhu yāvatā dve vā tīṇi vā gāmakkhettāni mahaggatanti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati.
analyzed: idha pana gahapati bhikkhu yāvatā dve vā tīṇi vā gāma khettāni mahaggatanti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati
translated: “Again, a bhikkhu abides resolved upon and pervading an area with two or three villages as ‘expansive.’

original: Ayampi vuccati, gahapati, mahaggatā cetovimutti.
analyzed: ayam pi vuccati gahapati mahaggatā cetaḥ vimutti
translated: This too is called the liberation of the mind by the expansive.

original: Idha pana, gahapati, bhikkhu yāvatā ekaṁ mahārajjaṁ mahaggatanti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati.
analyzed: idha pana gahapati bhikkhu yāvatā ekam mahā rajjam mahaggatanti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati
translated: “Again, a bhikkhu abides resolved upon and pervading an area with one kingdom as ‘expansive.’

original: Ayampi vuccati, gahapati, mahaggatā cetovimutti.
analyzed: ayam pi vuccati gahapati mahaggatā cetaḥ vimutti
translated: This too is called the liberation of the mind by the expansive.

original: Idha pana, gahapati, bhikkhu yāvatā dve vā tīṇi vā mahārajjāni mahaggatanti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati.
analyzed: idha pana gahapati bhikkhu yāvatā dve vā tīṇi vā mahā rajjāni mahaggatanti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati
translated: “Again, a bhikkhu abides resolved upon and pervading an area of two or three leagues with his heart end­ing only in the deathless.

original: Ayampi vuccati, gahapati, mahaggatā cetovimutti.
analyzed: ayam pi vuccati gahapati mahaggatā cetaḥ vimutti
translated: This too is called the liberation of the mind by measureless space.

original: Idha pana, gahapati, bhikkhu yāvatā samuddapariyantaṁ pathaviṁ mahaggatanti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati.
analyzed: idha pana gahapati bhikkhu yāvatā samudda pariyantam pathavim mahaggatam ti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati
translated: “Again, a bhikkhu abides resolved upon and pervading the area as far as the ocean with his heart ending only in the deathless.

original: Ayampi vuccati, gahapati, mahaggatā cetovimutti.
analyzed: ayam pi vuccati gahapati mahaggatā cetaḥ vimutti
translated: This too is called the liberation of the mind by measureless space.

original: Iminā kho etaṁ, gahapati, pariyāyena veditabbaṁ yathā ime dhammā nānatthā ceva nānābyañjanā ca.
analyzed: iminā kho eta gahapati pariyāyena veditabbam yathā ime dhammā nānatthā ca iva nānā byañjanā ca
translated: It is in this way that these things should be understood as different in meaning and different in name.

original: Catasso kho imā gahapati, bhavūpapattiyo.
analyzed: catassaḥ kho imāḥ gahapati bhava upapattiyaḥ
translated: “Householder, there are these four kinds of generation of beings.

original: Katamā catasso?
analyzed: katamā
translated: What four?

original: Idha, gahapati, ekacco ‘parittābhā’ti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati.
analyzed: idha gahapati ekaccaḥ parittābhāti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati
translated: “Here, some being generates beings in a limited way, resolving: ‘May they be limited.’

original: So kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā parittābhānaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: saḥ kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā paritta ābhānam devānam sahabyatam upapajjati
translated: With the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn in companionship with the limited gods.

original: Idha pana, gahapati, ekacco ‘appamāṇābhā’ti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati.
analyzed: idha pana gahapati ekaccaḥ pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati
translated: “Here, some being generates beings in an immeasurable way, resolving: ‘May they be immeasurable.’

original: So kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā appamāṇābhānaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: saḥ kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā appamāṇa ābhānam devānam sahabyatam upapajjati
translated: With the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn in companionship with the gods of Immeasurable Radiance.

original: Idha pana, gahapati, ekacco ‘saṅkiliṭṭhābhā’ti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati.
analyzed: idha pana gahapati ekaccaḥ pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati
translated: “Here, householder, someone pervades the first direction with a mind filled with loving-kindness,

original: So kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā saṅkiliṭṭhābhānaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: saḥ kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā devānam sahabyatam upapajjati
translated: With the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn in companionship with the gods of Defiled Radiance.

original: Idha pana, gahapati, ekacco ‘parisuddhābhā’ti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati.
analyzed: idha pana gahapati ekaccaḥ parisuddha ābhāti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati
translated: “Here, householder, someone pervades the first direction with a mind filled with loving-kindness,

original: So kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā parisuddhābhānaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: saḥ kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā parisuddha ābhānam devānam sahabyatam upapajjati
translated: With the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn in companionship with the gods of Pure Radiance.

original: Imā kho, gahapati, catasso bhavūpapattiyo.
analyzed: imāḥ kho gahapati catassaḥ bhava upapattiyaḥ
translated: “These, householder, are the four kinds of rebirth in the four directions.

original: Hoti kho so, gahapati, samayo, yā tā devatā ekajjhaṁ sannipatanti, tāsaṁ ekajjhaṁ sannipatitānaṁ vaṇṇanānattañhi kho paññāyati no ca ābhānānattaṁ.
analyzed: hoti kho saḥ gahapati samayaḥ yāḥ tāḥ devatāḥ ekajjham sannipatanti tāsam ekajjham sannipatitānam vaṇṇa nānattam hi kho paññāyati no ca ābhā nānattam
translated: “There comes a time, householder, when those deities assemble in one place. When they have assembled in one place, a difference in the excellence of their color and radiance is seen, but no difference in the excellence of their minds.

original: Seyyathāpi, gahapati, puriso sambahulāni telappadīpāni ekaṁ gharaṁ paveseyya.
analyzed: seyyathā api gahapati purisaḥ sambahulāni tela ppadīpāni ekam gharam paveseyya
translated: “Suppose a man were to bring many oil-lamps into a house.

original: Tesaṁ ekaṁ gharaṁ pavesitānaṁ accinānattañhi kho paññāyetha, no ca ābhānānattaṁ;
analyzed: tesam ekam gharam pavesitānam accinānattam hi kho paññāyetha no ca ābhānānatta
translated: If they were to enter one house, then the difference in their colors would be evident, but not the difference in their radiance.🔽So too, householder, there is an occasion when those deities assemble in one place. original: So telassapi aparisuddhattā vaṭṭiyāpi aparisuddhattā andhandhaṁ viya jhāyati;
analyzed: saḥ telassa api a parisuddha ttā vaṭṭiyā api a parisuddha ttā andhandham viya jhāyati
translated: Because of the impurity of the oil and the impurity of the wick, it burns dimly,

original: evameva kho, āvuso kaccāna, idhekacco bhikkhu ‘saṅkiliṭṭhābhā’ti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati,🔽tassa kāyaduṭṭhullampi na suppaṭippassaddhaṁ hoti, thinamiddhampi na susamūhataṁ hoti, uddhaccakukkuccampi na suppaṭivinītaṁ hoti.
analyzed: evam eva kho āvuso kaccāna idha ekaccaḥ bhikkhu saṅkiliṭṭhā ābhāti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati  tassa kāya duṭṭhullam pi na su paṭippassaddham hoti thinamiddham pi na su samūhatam hoti uddhacca kukkuccam pi na su paṭivinītam hoti
translated: even so, friend Kaccana, here a bhikkhu abides resolved upon and pervading an area with a defiled radiance.🔽His gross bodily imperfections are not fully comprehensible, his sluggishness and drowsiness are not fully comprehensible, his stiffness and unfitness are not fully comprehensible.

original: So kāyaduṭṭhullassapi na suppaṭippassaddhattā thinamiddhassapi na susamūhatattā uddhaccakukkuccassapi na suppaṭivinītattā andhandhaṁ viya jhāyati.
analyzed: so kāya duṭṭhullassa api na thinamiddhassa api na su samūhatattā uddhacca kukkuccassa api na su paṭivinīta ttā andhandham viya jhāyati
translated: Because of the grossness of his bodily imperfections, because of his sluggishness and drowsiness, because of his stiffness and unfitness, he burns dimly,

original: So kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā saṅkiliṭṭhābhānaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: saḥ kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā devānam sahabyatam upapajjati
translated: with the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn in companionship with the gods of the Defiled Radiance.

original: Seyyathāpi, āvuso kaccāna, telappadīpassa jhāyato telampi parisuddhaṁ vaṭṭipi parisuddhā.
analyzed: seyyathā api āvuso kaccāna telappadīpassa jhāyato telam pi parisuddham vaṭṭi pi parisuddhā
translated: Just as when an oil-lamp is burning with pure oil and a pure wick,

original: So telassapi parisuddhattā vaṭṭiyāpi parisuddhattā na andhandhaṁ viya jhāyati;
analyzed: saḥ telassa api parisuddha ttā vaṭṭiyā api parisuddha ttā na andhandham viya jhāyati
translated: it burns without being dimmed by smoke,

original: evameva kho, āvuso kaccāna, idhekacco bhikkhu ‘parisuddhābhā’ti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati.🔽Tassa kāyaduṭṭhullampi suppaṭippassaddhaṁ hoti, thinamiddhampi susamūhataṁ hoti, uddhaccakukkuccampi suppaṭivinītaṁ hoti.
analyzed: evam eva kho āvuso kaccāna idha ekaccaḥ bhikkhu parisuddhā ābhāti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati  tassa kāya duṭṭhullampi su paṭippassaddham hoti thinamiddhampi su samūhatam hoti uddhacca kukkuccampi su paṭivinītam hoti
translated: so too, friend Kaccāna, here a bhikkhu abides resolved upon and pervading an area with a pure radiance.🔽Then any bodily vexation or distress is abandoned, any mental vexation or distress is abandoned, any bodily or mental weariness is abandoned, and he abides without being dimmed by any obscuration.

original: So kāyaduṭṭhullassapi suppaṭippassaddhattā thinamiddhassapi susamūhatattā uddhaccakukkuccassapi suppaṭivinītattā na andhandhaṁ viya jhāyati.
analyzed: so kāya duṭṭhullassa api thinamiddhassa api su samūhatattā uddhacca kukkuccassa api su paṭivinīta ttā na andhandham viya jhāyati
translated: So he abides resolved upon and pervading an area with a pure radiance.

original: So kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā parisuddhābhānaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: saḥ kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā parisuddha ābhānam devānam sahabyatam upapajjati
translated: On the dissolution of the body, after death, he reappears in companionship with the gods of Pure Abodes.

original: Ayaṁ kho, āvuso kaccāna, hetu ayaṁ paccayo yena tāsaṁ devatānaṁ ekaṁ devanikāyaṁ upapannānaṁ santettha ekaccā devatā saṅkiliṭṭhābhā, santi panettha ekaccā devatā parisuddhābhā”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho āvuso kaccāna hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena tāsam devatānam ekam devanikāyam upapannānam santi ittha ekaccāḥ devatā saṅkiliṭṭha ābhā santi pana ittha ekaccāḥ devatā parisuddha ābhā ati
translated: This is the reason, this is the cause, why some of those deities, though reborn in the same divine world, have a limited life-span while others have an unlimited life-span.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, āyasmā sabhiyo kaccāno āyasmantaṁ anuruddhaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte āyasmā sabhiyaḥ kaccānaḥ āyasmantam anuruddham etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the venerable Sabhiya Kaccana said to the venerable Anuruddha:

original: “sādhu, bhante anuruddha.
analyzed: sādhu bhante anuruddha
translated: “It is a gain for us, venerable Anuruddha,

original: Na, bhante, āyasmā anuruddho evamāha:
analyzed: na bhante āyasmai anuruddhaḥ evam āha
translated: Venerable Anuruddha does not say:

original: ‘evaṁ me sutan’ti vā ‘evaṁ arahati bhavitun’ti vā;
analyzed: evam me vai evam vā
translated: ‘Thus have I heard’ or ‘This is how it is.’🔽But venerable Anuruddha says:

original: atha ca pana, bhante, āyasmā anuruddho ‘evampi tā devatā, itipi tā devatā’tveva bhāsati.
analyzed: atha ca pana bhante āyasmai anuruddhaḥ evam pi tāḥ devatāḥ tāḥ devatā tu eva bhāsati
translated: ‘Such is that deity, such is that deity.’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, bhante, evaṁ hoti:
analyzed: tassa bhante evam hoti
translated: Venerable sir, I think thus:

original: ‘addhā āyasmatā anuruddhena tāhi devatāhi saddhiṁ sannivutthapubbañceva sallapitapubbañca sākacchā ca samāpajjitapubbā’”ti.
analyzed: addhā āyasmatā anuruddhena tāhi devatāhi saddhim sannivuttha pubbam ca iva sallapita pubbam ca sākacchā ca samāpajjita pubbā ati
translated: Surely venerable Anuruddha must have associated with those deities, talked with them, and held conversations with them.”

original: “Addhā kho ayaṁ, āvuso kaccāna, āsajja upanīya vācā bhāsitā,
analyzed: addhā kho ayaṃ āvuso kaccānaḥ āsajjaḥ upanīya vācā bhāsitā
translated: “Surely, friend Kaccana, you have spoken too soon,

original: api ca te ahaṁ byākarissāmi:
analyzed: api ca te aham byākarissāmi
translated: But still I will answer you.

original: ‘dīgharattaṁ kho me, āvuso kaccāna, tāhi devatāhi saddhiṁ sannivutthapubbañceva sallapitapubbañca sākacchā ca samāpajjitapubbā’”ti.
analyzed: dīgharattam kho me āvuso kaccāna tāhi devatāhi saddhim sannivuttha pubbam ca iva sallapita pubbam ca sākacchā ca samāpajjita pubbā ati
translated: ‘For a long time, friend Kaccāna, I have been living with those deities, talking and conversing with them.’

original: Evaṁ vutte, āyasmā sabhiyo kaccāno pañcakaṅgaṁ thapatiṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte āyasmā sabhiyaḥ kaccāno pañcakaṅgam thapatim etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the venerable Kaccana replied:

original: “lābhā te, gahapati, suladdhaṁ te, gahapati,
analyzed: lābhā te gahapati su laddham te gahapati
translated: ‘Householder, it is a gain for you, it is a great gain for you

original: yaṁ tvañceva taṁ kaṅkhādhammaṁ pahāsi, mayañcimaṁ dhammapariyāyaṁ alatthamhā savanāyā”ti.🔽Anuruddhasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ sattamaṁ.
analyzed: yam tvam ca iva tam kaṅkhā dhammam pahāsi mayan ca imam dhamma pariyāyam alatthamhā savanāya ati 🔽anuruddha suttam niṭṭhitam sattama
translated: that you have abandoned that doubtful point.’🔽The Sutta with Anuruddha is finished. The seventh.
